hanzi-su-wiki:
慣

Значения

Привыкать; приучать

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Навык — привычка сердца 忄 к машинальности, как при изготовлении бус 串 из ракушек 貝.

Варианты

惯

accustomed to; used to; indulge; to spoil (a child)
привык к; привыкший; предаваться; испортить (ребенок)

Keyword_KANJIDIC: accustomed, get used to, become experienced
koohiiStory1: It took him awhile, but Data finally got ACCUSTOMED to his nipple/breast piercings. They were constantly rubbing up against his shirt and his heart-shaped locket. Picture Data, shirtless, squeezing his nipples in front of Picard and saying "Yes, at first they were a bit shelly, but I´ve grown quite ACCUSTOMED to them". That last bit should do it for you.
koohiiStory2: Some hardcore monks have a state of mind that has become accustomed to their self-torture through piercing themselves.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you could just get your soul to open the window to shellfish, you'll grow accustomed to them sooner or later! I know shellfish are a bit of an acquired taste, but if you don't open that window, you'll never like them!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Close your eyes and picture your soul. Now your soul is opening a little window inside of you that is the perfect size for shellfish of all kinds. Hopefully with exposure and acceptance you'll grow accustomed to them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You'll need to become accustomed to eating shellfish if you want to grow up big and strong like Genghis Khan (かん). He didn't have shellfish growing up either you know, he had to grow accustomed to their taste too, but look how successful he was!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Force yourself to get accustomed to shellfish like Genghis Khan, then maybe you'll rule most of the planet someday.

guàn: (глаг) баловать, потакать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: (at first) it pierced (貫) your heart (忄) but then you got used to it
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Monks have become accustomed to all piercing states of mind and are at peace.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " heart " to the " through " sound. The original meaning is habit and habituation. "Shuowen" is used as " break ". Both " used " and "掼" are differentiated words of " guan ", which represent customary meaning. Later generations use " accustomed " instead of " broke ". "Word Supplement. "Hand": "Cut, get used to the original character. Today's practice is used to practice." An example is Du You's "Tong Dian. "Official Official Code": "This person is accustomed to nature, accustomed to seeking profit, shameless, how can he be inferior." Song Dynasty Mei Yaochen "Send Wang's Works to Xijing for Shouan": "Not used to eating Zhou Su, still Ying Yi Chuping."

The extension of " used " means connivance and indulgence. For example, Yan Jidao of the Song Dynasty "Partridge Tian": "Menghun was used to being unchecked, and stepped on Yanghua to cross Xieqiao." Chapter 9 of "Jin Ping Mei Ci Hua": "How long has he been here? No idea!"
humanum_short_description_en: From the " heart " to the sound of " through ". The original meaning is habit and habituation.
humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「貫」聲。本義是習慣、習以為常。《說文》作「摜」。「慣」和「摜」都是「貫」的分化字，表示習慣義。後世用「慣」而不用「摜」。《字彙補．手部》：「摜，慣本字。今摜習之摜作慣。」例子如唐代杜佑《通典．職官典》：「此人習與性成，慣於求利，苟得無恥，豈蹈廉隅。」宋代梅堯臣〈送王著作赴西京壽安〉：「未慣餐周粟，還應憶楚萍。」

　　「慣」引申表示縱容、放任。如宋代晏幾道〈鷓鴣天〉：「夢魂慣得無拘檢，又踏楊花過謝橋。」《金瓶梅詞話》第9回：「他來了多少時，便這等慣了他，大姐好沒分曉！」
humanum_short_description: 從「心」，「貫」聲。本義是習慣、習以為常。

從「 心 」，「 貫 」聲。本義是習慣、習以為常。《說文》作「 摜 」。「 慣 」和「 摜 」都是「 貫 」的分化字，表示習慣義。後世用「 慣 」而不用「 摜 」。《字彙補．手部》：「摜，慣本字。今摜習之摜作慣。」例子如唐代杜佑《通典．職官典》：「此人習與性成，慣於求利，苟得無恥，豈蹈廉隅。」宋代梅堯臣〈送王著作赴西京壽安〉：「未慣餐周粟，還應憶楚萍。」 「 慣 」引申表示縱容、放任。如宋代晏幾道〈鷓鴣天〉：「夢魂慣得無拘檢，又踏楊花過謝橋。」《金瓶梅詞話》第9回：「他來了多少時，便這等慣了他，大姐好沒分曉！」
From the " heart" to the " through" sound. The original meaning is habit and habituation. "Shuowen" is used as " break". Both " used" and " 掼" are differentiated words of " guan", which represent customary meaning. Later generations use " accustomed" instead of " broke". "Word Supplement. "Hand": "Cut, get used to the original character. Today's practice is used to practice." An example is Du You's "Tong Dian. "Official Official Code": "This person is accustomed to nature, accustomed to seeking profit, shameless, how can he be inferior." Song Dynasty Mei Yaochen "Send Wang's Works to Xijing for Shouan": "Not used to eating Zhou Su, still Ying Yi Chuping." The extension of " used" means connivance and indulgence. For example, Yan Jidao of the Song Dynasty "Partridge Tian": "Menghun was used to being unchecked, and stepped on Yanghua to cross Xieqiao." Chapter 9 of "Jin Ping Mei Ci Hua": "How long has he been here? No idea!"

慣字的基本解释

慣
guàn
见“惯”。

慣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［guàn］
［《廣韻》古患切，去諫，見。］
“惯1”的繁体字。
(1)习惯；经常。
(2)纵容；放任。
(3)用同“貫”。通；穿。

慣字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　慣； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页399第13
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古患切，音丱。習也。　又通作貫。【詩·魏風】三歲貫女。　本作摜。从手貫聲。今文作慣。

慣字的源字形

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

guàn
вм. 惯
Radicals: 忄, 毋, 貝  (soul, window, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you could just get your soul to open the window to shellfish, you'll grow accustomed to them sooner or later! I know shellfish are a bit of an acquired taste, but if you don't open that window, you'll never like them!
Close your eyes and picture your soul. Now your soul is opening a little window inside of you that is the perfect size for shellfish of all kinds. Hopefully with exposure and acceptance you'll grow accustomed to them.
Reading Mnemonic
You'll need to become accustomed to eating shellfish if you want to grow up big and strong like Genghis Khan (かん). He didn't have shellfish growing up either you know, he had to grow accustomed to their taste too, but look how successful he was!
Force yourself to get accustomed to shellfish like Genghis Khan, then maybe you'll rule most of the planet someday.
